concept.title: ActivityCard
concept.shortdesc: Activity Cards show relevant blockchain events, as well as relevant off-chain activities. They serve as a library of what is possible and a timeline of what happened.

conbody.p: In the current version of TokenScript Activity Cards show the history of a token. This might seem trivial, since any wallets connects to a blockchain which is a shared historiy of transactions.

But if you ever used dApps with a standard wallet like MetaMask, you know how important Activity Cards are. Usually the wallet just shows transactions, in best cases, it also shows the token involved. This might be enough for plain value transfers.

But if you have token interacting with smart contracts - like, renting a car, lending a token, exchanging tokens and so on - the information of a plain transaction gets close to zero. Your wallet simply doesn't understand what happened.

An Activity Card is assigned to a token and creates, stores and loads Data Objects. By this, wallets suddenly become smart: They remember not only the transaction, but also the purpose of the transaction - that a user rented a car, lended or exchanged a token and so on.

In future releases of TokenScript Activity Cards will support more functions and data objects. They can structure what a user can do with a token, like allowing it to redeem some other token, restricting its transferability or linking it to something which happens in the future.
